benchmark_details.name: SYLLABUS QA (A Course Logistics Question Answering Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce SYLLABUS QA, an open-source dataset with 63 real course syllabi covering 36 majors, containing 5,078 open-ended course logistics-related question-answer pairs that are diverse in both question types and answer formats.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a dataset for developing and evaluating automated question answering approaches for logistics-related questions in education.

data.source: 63 unique course syllabi collected from instructors across 12 universities worldwide.
data.annotation: Crowd annotated by over 200 annotators simulating logistics-related QA pairs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by evaluating factual information overlap between annotator-written ground truth answers and model predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in Fact-QA metrics indicate accurate and relevant answers, while lower scores suggest hallucination or factual inaccuracies.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance on Fact-QA Precision is 0.707, Recall is 0.664.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across various LLM models and compared against human performance metrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: To ensure anonymity, personally identifiable information was removed from syllabi.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Explicit consent collected from all annotators.
